website_summaries.verdict: Multitasking earbuds that can manage your business calls, favorite playlists and more.
pros: Emits smooth sounds that are crisp enough to block out the noise of an airplane engine
Customers note product's ability to resonate low bass frequencies cleanly and over the course of time
We love that it comes with multiple earbud sizes
cons: Not designed for high impact sports, but  worth the try

website_summaries.verdict: These may be small, but they pack a powerful sound. Comfortable and secure silicone helps these buds stay in place.
pros: Durable 3.9-foot cord is flat to help prevent tangles
Features an integrated microphone for taking calls from your smartphone
Android users can enjoy use of the Smart Key app for extra control
cons: Some users report white noise when no music playing

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, horrible bumping sound whenever the cord is tapped
customer_reviews.text: To start, the earbuds sound very good and are decently comfortable. However, there is one very big problem that makes these bad. When inserted into your ears correctly and the cord it tapped (even very lightly), major feedback is sent through the drivers. It makes a loud bumping sound. Along with this, any time you even move your jaw or neck, you hear it super loudly, I think because of the way these are designed. At first I thought it was a defect, but I got a replacement pair and had the same issue. If you listen to music only when you don't move a single muscle, these are great. For everyone else, find a better pair.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Just Extra Bass, but all Bass
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as many other earbuds do tend to lack the bass response for a quality listening experience. But these are all bass, not just extra base. No "life" to them. Extremely heavy on the bass to lower-mid frequencies, but lack any character in the upper-mid to treble. Vocals are muffled, stringed instruments lack any sparkle/clarity, percussion (cymbals) missing the beloved "crash and sizzle". I've owned other Sony earbuds in the past with great success, but sadly, these are nowhere near the former's sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: I-gor

customer_reviews.title: Painful fit
customer_reviews.text: These are the most uncomfortable earbuds I have ever worn. The sound is great. But the piece that fits inside your ear (not the rubber piece that goes in the ear canal) pushes up against the cartilage of my ear. Maybe I just have small ears, I don't know. But this piece seems larger than normal. I've had Sony earbuds before, and they didn't hurt like this. Difficult to wear for any length of time; which negates the reason I bought them: to wear all day at work and block out noise.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Buzzing
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months of owning these earbuds (under responsible care), they've been making a buzzing metallic noise out of nowhere that cuts in and out while I'm listening to msusic. Just my luck that the product support window closed 10 days ago.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, low quality, NEVER buy Sony Audio products, I never lasts.
customer_reviews.text: This product is too expensive, and it doesn’t last. Same goes to all sony audio products, it just never last more than 8 months before one earbud goes dead, I’ve bought this item specifically several times, trust me, IT DOESN’T LAST. I have three of these earbuds, two older ones and a professional 7506 one, none of them lasted more than a year. Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor cancelation of surrounding sounds
customer_reviews.text: The surrounding noise cancelation is terrible. I wanted a good set of earphones to wear while I am talking on my cell phone and walking. The person I am talking to cuts in and out everytime any bit of wind blows. I tried to figure out how to contact Sony customer service about this but after looping round and round their website I couldn't chat with anyone. I would love for them to back their product so if anyone could respond to this review that would be great.
customer_reviews.author: ranee

customer_reviews.title: Good but painful
customer_reviews.text: These are good earbuds. I buy Sony earbuds every few years and I usually love them. Sound quality is always crystal clear with very good bass. These earbuds do you have good sound quality. However the housing of the earbuds, not the actual soft earpiece itself, hurt my ears. The housing will touch the inside of your ear canal and eventually will make them very sore similar to a bud that has not silicone insert.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Me and my husband wanted a good pair of headphones and we ordered 2 pairs ($ 350 plus a protection plan ) so exited when they arrived, they sent wrong headphones and were defective so we sent back, and order 6 pairs of different headphones from different brands .... and these are absolute the Best !!!!! For price , quality, noise cancellation, bass . We got another pair of these, $29.99 a pair from $59.99 We use them everyday , to listen music , watch movies . Very comfortable for long period of time, my ears are a bit small and it's hard to find a pair of headphones that fit and stay in . Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Druta

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This product only has a 90 warranty. I had the 'buds for 4 and a half months when the plastic covering the wire between the plug and the earbuds began to separate. I have taped it over with electrical tape to keep it from grounding out, but it is just a matter of time until the cable breaks. I would definitely recommend NOT buying this product. You can get earbuds that sound just as good with a lot better build quality and warranty for a whole lot less. If you buy this set, be aware that you're paying for the name and little else.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and inferior...
customer_reviews.text: Despite EXTRA BASS being the biggest advertised feature here, I found the bass to be very weak, and the overall volume to be waaay too low. I have to turn up the volume several notches higher on whatever I'm listening to, because it's not loud enough. These are well below the sound quality found in basic wired Apple earbuds. Even the $7 Panasonic ergofit buds sound almost equal in bass, and cost a whole $23 dollars less
customer_reviews.author: Vic Viper 001

customer_reviews.title: Wow...when they say "extra bass", they're not kidding!
customer_reviews.text: As I'm editing more and more videos on my laptop lately, I've found myself needing some good old-fashioned in-ear buds...not bluetooth...not AirPods...no lightning cable...none of that. Just a decent pair of headphones I can plug in to my 3.5 jack and get to work. So far I'm really impressed with these: -Flat cable -Lightweight/comfortable -Really good bass (They're punchier than my Beats!) -Clear through mid-range and treble Finally, they're clear enough to accurately mix audio (they're $30...definitely not going to stand up against high-end reference monitors, but come on...that price?) but I'll need to remind myself that they're boosted on the low end...not really a problem. Definitely happy with these so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nick A.

customer_reviews.title: Ehh, Just OK
customer_reviews.text: First, what I like about them is the build quality. They look and feel solid - nicely built. They also fit snugly in your ears, and have a coated cable - so the build of them isn't an issue. The sound on the other hand is mediocre at best. Out of the box, the mid-bass is strong and lacking in all other frequencies, especially detail/presence. The sub-bass is weak, mid is kind of muddy, and the presence is UA (unauthorized absence). You can tell that the focus was bass, mostly mid bass at that. However, with the right EQ you can bring them to life and they're pretty decent at that point.
customer_reviews.author: Wood

customer_reviews.title: turns my android volume down by itself
customer_reviews.text: I've tried multiple sets of headphones with my sony xperia android phone, thinking that sony would match up with sony nicely i didn't think it was the headphones that was causing my problem but after trying other headphones i can say confidently that these were the problem. Considering I only bought these phones for use with my phone, these are now only a source of frustration for me. Bass is good though, when the volume isn't muted automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Bookman

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that for $30 these earbuds are not bad at all. If your strictly looking for some bass heavy cheap earbuds these are perfect for you. Overall comparing them to other earbuds I've used, they're just very average. Bass is good for earbuds but because of this extra bass overall sound quality suffers some in bass heavy songs. They look kind of funky but seem to be made well and they're pretty comfortable. I'd recommend them if bass is whats most important to you and you're on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Decent pair of bassy earphones, not hifi
customer_reviews.text: Only commenting on sound quality and material feeling since I've had this for a few days. Sound quality: 3/5 It does provide a bassy profile but at the sacrifice of the mids and highs. I find the bass is also a bit muddy/hollow and meshes too much into the midbass. It some songs, namely songs with not so much midbass, it seems to be good as it comes off punchy. Ok for 30 bucks and sound profile it is going for. Material: 4/5 It seems pretty alright. I like flat headphone wires and these are it, also fairly thin. You can hear the wire if it moves....but most earphones are like that.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham R.

customer_reviews.title: Squishy Things Fall Off Quickly
customer_reviews.text: The only negative thing I have to say about these earbuds is that the squishy things on the end of the bugs that go in your ear and hold them there, tend too fall off too quickly...in a pocket, in a bag, etc. rendering the unit useless if completely lost. Currently, I noticed mine lost both squishy things and I found one on an overshirt I commonly wear, thankfully, but the other earbud piede is gone forever. The sound is wonderful and I would recommend them for that, just glue the squishy things on or something so they are not lost to the four winds.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail S. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great looking headphones, but cords create a lot of static noise
customer_reviews.text: I bought the red color headphones which look great and are not flimsy at all. The built quality is really good at this price point. The biggest drawback was that the cords created a lot of static noise once they rubbed against the shirt or at the slightest movement. If you are sitting in one position without moving the it will be fine, but atleast in the one I received, I could hear a lot of crackling sound/ static noise with movement
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good, but has it's drawbacks.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bass, but not much better than the other Sony's they replace, (not the cheap walmart Sony earbuds, which are horrible by any standard). These a just too heavy for running, the cords are needlessly heavy and the earbuds themselves are heavy. They continually fall out even with the largest rubber pieces. 3 out of 5 because, although they sound great, they are priced too high for what you get, and the weight issue when using for sports.
customer_reviews.author: Kells Reviews

customer_reviews.title: BEST SOUNDING EARBUDS AT THIS PRICE - PERIOD!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried just about every kind of earbud there is, and always use wired ones. I'm not a bluetooth kind of guy. I use these to do any yard work, cutting firewood with a heavy-duty chainsaw, running heavy equipment - I do it all with these - and they do an excellent job of not only blocking out the noise, but giving me a deep bass sound experience with NO distortion EVER at 100% volume every time. These things are awesome, and will continue to buy these regularly...As I go through them fairly often. Get them - you will NOT regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good
customer_reviews.text: Sound is decent , not sure i would spend the money again on another pair. Your buying the name for sure. Don't get me wrong I like Sony stuff. There are less expensive ones with the same sound quality such as the Sephia SP3060 Earbuds, Noise Isolating in Ear Headphones, for like for $13.00. I'm pretty rough on my ear buds, and have multiple sets all over the place. truck, home, work. I really like the reinforce exterior braided sheath on the wire of the Sephia's, not sure if its metal or a plastic. Just to let you know, I'm not being compensated in any way from these products. I'm an everyday consumer just like you.
customer_reviews.author: Willie Horton

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Bass
customer_reviews.text: I suppose it's my fault for buying a pair of headphones with the subtitle "Extra Bass". But these phones quite literally have too much bass, to the point where the bass drowns out other aspects of sound quality. For an audiophile like my self, the sound quality on these is atrocious. Recommended only for bass heads, all others stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design and the world's most uncomfortable earbuds...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the sound quality and noise cancellation are good (the bass is just ok). My main complaint, and the reason why I'm giving the 1 star, is these physically hurt to wear. They basically did into your ear cartilage and start to hurt your ears within 30 minutes of wearing them. And because of the angle of the ear buds themselves, if you try to turn them to make it more comfortable on your ear, it hurts your inner ear and the sound quality goes down. Awful design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tinny, missing the "EXTRA Bass" Over priced for what you're getting!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for work so I didn't need anything special. However, I passed on a $9 pair in favor of a Sony-branded product in the hopes that the build and quality would be superior. Regrettably, I was wrong. These are about as good as $9 headphones. The sound quality is horrible. They are very tinny. Interestingly, the supposed Extra Bass seems to be missing. As I will be using these for YouTube TV, I don't really need them for music. However, if you're considering these for that purpose, skip them and get something a little better. I've had great results with Skull Candy's if you're thinking about an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: Stop searching and buy
customer_reviews.text: There's an interesting story that goes with this, but I won't bore you with it. Let's just boil it down to two points: I'm a ver serious audiophile, and I'm very cheap. Despite being so cheap, I've spent a fortune on earbuds through the years because they are one-and-all built so terribly that they hardly last long enough to get them out of the packaging. I went bluetooth, but that was even worse since I use my earbuds for jogging, and they would just come flopping out over and over. In any event, the point is that you have found the best sounding earbuds priced at under $75.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Quality always costs less....
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a set that was far better than the crap for sale at a truck stop or the local convenience store. I bought 3 sets of the el' cheapo's.....that would have covered these. Not one of them ever sounded worth a #&$%!! These Sony's however, are high in quality, without breaking the bank. They honestly do sound excellent, and even "feel" somewhat, solid. I have learned my lesson before, and it ticks me off when I try to save a buck and go cheap. It always costs more in the end... I would buy these again, if they ever came up missing!
customer_reviews.author: AVANTMARINE401

customer_reviews.title: best quality at the price point by far
customer_reviews.text: By far the best quality for the price. It’s right in line with mid level earbuds in cost, whereas the sound quality is on par with every pair of high end ear buds I’ve tried. What’s more is that the sound quality doesn’t weaken at all through its lifespan. Their lifespan seems to be in the two year range, which is exceptional for earbuds. I use them as long as 4 hours a day every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than beats...
customer_reviews.text: So great. My son wanted beats3 but the reviews are horrible. These are amazing. Even has noise cancelling which is cool, but my son never hears me as it is lol anyways, he says these work well and was surprised. We we're not. Sony has never let us down. It too about a month to convince him to try it. He's glad he did plus I get to say I told u so! Haha
customer_reviews.author: NicoleB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, High Quality Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Was tired of the poor quality of the common throw-away type earbuds. Upgraded to these, matched to a Sony NW-A35 16GB Walkman digital music player. Super happy with the results. Sound quality is full, rich, and excellent. Build quality is excellent. It is amazing what a little thicker plastic, and heavier wire, will do for you. Have had them a couple of months and are very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conradt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Headphones
customer_reviews.text: What I Like: -headphones stay put in my ear, and come with 3 different sized soft gel-like ear inserts (to fit any sized ear) -love the quality and color (I purchased the red colored head phones) -portable and durable -chord doesn't seem to tangle as easily as others I've tried -sound quality is nice, but nothing that will blow you away -price was about on par for what you get What I don't like: -sound quality is just okay, its not bad at all, but not great either. For what these are, they work well. Would I buy them again? Maybe, ..I'd want to try a few other brands, but would be happy to replace these w/ the same pair.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: OK, These are Nice
customer_reviews.text: This design really fits the human ear (not just mine). They go in snugly and stay put with no discomfort. As far as sound goes, What can one say? Some people will say they’re incredible. Others will say they’re junk. Everyone has different standards. To quote Billy Joel, "....you can’t get the sound from a story in a magazine.". I can say that they are inarguably on a significantly higher level than anything that came with your phone. Personally, I love the way they sound. For the price, I am highly satisfied. I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Dosch

customer_reviews.title: Meh, Good for Spoken Words, Poor for Music
customer_reviews.text: How is this a 4.5 star product? Did I even get the same set as everyone else? If you just want some earbuds to talk on your phone or listen to spoken podcasts, these will do. But for music, do yourself a favor and buy something else. These do NOT have extra bass. They sound flat, even at high volume. I have had urBeats earphones in the past, which I loved. This Sony headset doesn't even come close in sound quality. urBeats are also a little less bulky and more comfortable than these. That is what I am buying to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: these are my 'go-to' headphones
customer_reviews.text: i have had these for a few months and yet i have bought several other headphone just to make sure,,, due to my picky nature with headphones and my home office demand. that being said,,, the other head phones have great reviews but i was never satisfied or as impressed with them so i keep coming back to these sony headphones.. these headphones are louder, clearer and very consistent in quality... no complaints!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Getting more than you paid for
customer_reviews.text: Love em... I use them for zoom meetings and for my PlayStation. They’re worth way more than they cost. I’ve had very expensive Bose in ear headphones and super cheap skull candy ones and this is almost as good as my Bose for clarity and bass. It’s a headphone jack (not Bluetooth) so you can’t use them for any newer-ish iPhone or galaxy phone or tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Chilton

customer_reviews.title: Best earbuds i've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing quality, much better than any other headphones around this price point. I've had my pair for 2 years now, and it has been through hell and back, but they still work like new. I've never had earbuds that have ever lasted so long before. The build quality is amazing, and the confort is amazing. These headphones have been stepped on, flooded, and thrown around a million times, but they still work flawlessly. When these die, im just gonna buy another pair, because they are really are that good. And the bass is the absolute best you can get without spending $250 on some really nice earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Marie m.

customer_reviews.title: Good earbud for the money
customer_reviews.text: This earbud has good sound for the money, and fit comfortably with extra earpieces supplied to customize the fit. They appear to be well built. My only complaint is that the microphone, while on a telephone call, will pick up noise if the cord is in contact with clothing, for example if the phone is in your pocket, when you are moving about. Although the person that you are talking with will hear the noise, the wearer cannot hear the noise, and will only know about the presence of the noise if the listener should mention it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too much bass
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, but too sound was muddy. I suspect it was from the heavy bass tuning, but it really drowns out the mids and highs. Compared on the same MacBook Pro to Sony's over-ear studio Professional headphones, which were much clearer sounding. I know these are half the price, but was hoping for decent enough quality in an earbud form, and these just didn't cut it. Also they use a right-angle jack, which for my personal preference is a negative. Also, advertised is a "tangle-free, Y-type flat cord" and while it is "flat," it is far more round than most other tangle-free cords.
customer_reviews.author: stew1e

customer_reviews.title: Thick and rubbery
customer_reviews.text: I hate giving a negative review but I'm disappointed. The earbud ends are huge, and the whole thing is thick and rubbery, which make the cord feel heavy. There are several different size earbud ends, but none fit comfortably. They don't fully cancel outside noise, but they muffle it if you jam the buds in pretty good, but that just makes them uncomfortable and it lessens the sound quality. The sound quality is OK if not jammed into your ears but not as great as described. Aside from the over-sized buds they feel like something designed more for children.
customer_reviews.author: TFox

customer_reviews.title: Not Great, but Decent Bass for $30
customer_reviews.text: They work well for me. While there is a definite bass sound, it does not seem deep. However, for $30 I’m pleased. One reviewer said they were large and heavy. They seem quite comfortable to me. I have even cheaper ear phones that are lighter but they are not more comfortable. Their size and substance actually feel better to me. Maybe a different rubber cover could help. I understand that there is a a lot of personal preference. I would like deeper bass, but I also have a $65 dollar set of Idea Bluetooth headphones sound better. It seems hard to get good bass under $50.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Withstands being yanked and jostled.  Sounds good enough. Ear caps fall off.
customer_reviews.text: These Sony MDR SB-50AP headphones have been reliable so far, still fully functional despite being yanked at both the plug and ear ends, stuffed into bags and pockets, and dropped or tossed around. Have not gotten them wet yet. Microphone sounds good and the pause/play button works every time. Sometimes the ear caps, which fit well and filter most but not all ambient noise, fall off then the buds are yanked out of the ears, and I've lost two already; therefore I'm gonna buy Comply foam replacements.
customer_reviews.author: S. Yu

customer_reviews.title: BLUF: Buy these earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These have excellent sound quality for earbuds. I've switched to these after 10 years of being a strict skull candy user (which are also an excellent product) and I am extremely happy with the fit in the ear, the nice little draw string bag it comes with, the fit and finish of the earbud casing and cable, and the general aesthetic. I would recommend these to anyone looking for a high quality product at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, just a little large
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace some basic skull candy that I use in my full face motorcycle helmet that were worn out. Don't get me wrong, these are great headphones, but the driver is pretty deep compared to the skull candy which poses an issue when taking my full face helmet on and off. Otherwise these are great headphones, they just don't for my unique application as well as I had hoped. The lows and mids for an in ear headphone is pretty impressive, the highs are about like any other headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy If You Like Ear Pain
customer_reviews.text: Wow, should have paid attention to other reviewers saying they will hurt your ears. They sure do! They are just too big for my ears and I don't have small ears. The pain would maybe be worth it if the sound was great, but, it is not. The sound is average at most. Yes, they have bass but he mediocre mid and high tones are meh.
customer_reviews.author: straightforward

customer_reviews.title: Self-defeating
customer_reviews.text: They do well enough in the sound department, haven't noticed anything that really stands out. The downsides are significant, though. The cords constantly rub against my shirt, no matter how much I pin or twist them out of the way, so I ultimately hear nothing but cord noise. The buds themselves are so bulky that I can't position them without hurting my outer ears after a short while. I actually have to remove them to stop the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan B.

customer_reviews.title: Product failed 8 months after purchase
customer_reviews.text: After 8 months, the sound volume on the right side is always whispering low. I have tested on 3 separate players with the same result. Warranty document at Amazon web site says 1 year warranty, that's FALSE! The warranty document in the box says 90 days. I learned that after contacting Sony customer support. Not reliable enough for a $30 product! This must be a common issue with this product because it has a specific FAQ about the low sound volume on one side of the headset at the Sony support web site.
customer_reviews.author: QDT

customer_reviews.title: Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: If you look at my order history there is a gaggle of shoe & earphone orders. I have the worst taste in cheap earbuds but I decided to spend a few more dollars and try to nab some quality buds for a change. So far the Sony's have not disappointed. If you spend 10.00 on something the shelf life is not very long. I like cheap stuff but I end up buying more for less quality. I like these, they feel good in the hands and don't feel cheap. The sound is pretty good as well. A good buy for 30.00 bux.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: The left side earbud has no sound coming out of it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve actually bought these headphones once before and I really enjoyed the sound quality and noise canceling abilities but I recently purchased a new pair as a gift for my little nephew. a few days after giving him the headphones he told me that the sound was only coming from the right earbud and not the left one. Maybe it got damaged when it was shipping or it was an assembly mistake but I would like a replacement if that’s possible.
customer_reviews.author: nicolas gamez

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite ear buds
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought these in Japan when I was traveling because my earbuds went out. I love them, and can say they are my favorites to date (and this includes Klipsche, sennheiser, other sony models, bose, etc). I had them for 3 years (until I lost it... just bought another one since it's super cheap) and they have been through some abuse. I use it while i'm traveling and also when im just walking around or working out at the gym. I love the bass quality, clear highs, and how durable they are. I'm a fan.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for quite some time now. I've used many earphones and headphones including some quite expensive ones but found the best sound quality as well as comfort with these. The mic works great as well. These look a little big but are super comfortable in the ears. I have sensitive ears and had problems with other earphones and earbuds causing irritation after longer use of about 2 hours or so. But in these times while working from home, these have been so great for me as I can wear them all day long. The sound quality is full of bass and crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Aayush Sisodia

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Fantastic sound!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a pair of V-moda Bass Freq earbuds for quite a few years. I have been very happy with them. But one side started losing volume. When I looked at V-moda for a new pair of earbuds, it looks like they have gone up-market with the least expensive earbuds being multiple times more costly than Bass Freqs. Needless to say, I began looking elsewhere. Found these Sony earbuds on a review site. I have had Sony headphones off and on since the first Walkman came out, so it was an easy choice to select these when backed up by great reviews. Wow! They sound absolutely fantastic! Definitely geared toward those that like to hear clear, low-frequency bass.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth and Only the Truth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wired earbuds. Sound quality is wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for wired earbuds and it’s hard to find any that are better than Sony with extra bass. They are great earbuds, have wonderful sound, and I would definitely buy them again. Mostly comfortable except that you can sometimes feel the hard exterior of the air bud. I wish the inner ear piece was just a little bit longer so you couldn’t feel that part. Wouldn’t recommend sleeping with them, as the hard metal exterior may make your ear sore. Otherwise they’re awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Linniebee

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: The different sizes on the earbuds made it super easy to find the right size for my ears, which run a little small generally. They are pretty bulky, so I was nervous when they first came that they would be heavy in my ears, but they're very comfortable! I would say that they're not great at noise cancellation, but the bass is phenomenal for in-ear earbuds. The cord seems sturdy and does seem like it would be tangle-resistant. The small bag that it comes with seems nice as well! 9/10 would recommend! Especially for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: JasmineRae

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Not so amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice colors. Good length. Multiple ear bud sizes. Cons: Not very durable. Speaker (ear buds) quality declined over 6 months. Bang for the buck...letter grade C-. Ended up replacing then for older Samsung wired earbuds. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Son says these are the best sound quality ever
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son a few years back when he was in high school. I've tried to convince him to let me buy newer ones/ updated ones for college. But he adamantly refuses saying that these are the best sound quality of any he's ever had and better than any he has tried of his friends and hall mates. He just buys new bud covers once in a while. He swears these are better than full coverage headphones like "Beats". Go figure?... A rejected offer to buy something new for a teen... refreshing. Ha!
customer_reviews.author: WJ694X118734

customer_reviews.title: Two months they're dead
customer_reviews.text: The title says it all. I really expected to get a little more time out of these. Even though they are relatively cheap earbuds, they do carry the Sony brand name. All in all, they sounded good with good battery life. But two months of light use, they were dead...nothing. Shame on Sony for putting their name on such a cheap product!
customer_reviews.author: S. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: PUBG Footsteps.... I can hear it all now....
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for for some PC gaming. I've been using Steel series Arctic 7 for over a year with not many complaints. I mainly play Pubg so for those who also play you know sound is everything. These earbuds are hands down one of the best purchases I've made in a bit. The sound is crisp. Footsteps are so much more clear. The added bass really helps out. I did have to purchase a splitter to get the mic to work (hasn't been delivered yet). I would recommend to anybody looking for an affordable option for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: salasrasta416

customer_reviews.title: Just pull the trigger on this.
customer_reviews.text: I am putting this particular set of Sony IEMs on my top 5 list of all time regardless of cost. I can go into all the blah blah blah about soundstage and so on and so forth so I look like I really know what I'm talking about if you would like. These are a solid set of in ear monitors. If you don't know a lot about headphones.... The best advice I can give... Is just pull the trigger. I don't think you'll regret it. Under $50. There's not much to think about here with this set.
customer_reviews.author: Studio guy.

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent earbuds!
customer_reviews.text: I love these earbuds. I wasn’t expecting the awesome audio quality that comes out of these things. All the sounds are there, the highs, the mids, the bass, all present and all very well defined. Build quality is excellent. I don’t suspect these will be falling apart on me any time soon. They’re pretty comfortable to wear, on that note however they feel a bit heavy in the ear. It’s nothing too dramatic though as they feel like they aren’t going anywhere when I wear them. I’m very pleased with this purchase and highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: PhxBlue

customer_reviews.title: Ok, I would recommend you save your money and allocate funds to a higher end set.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say these are not that great. In defense I am pretty picky about audio and only have experience with higher end audio products. With that said, Sennheiser, Bose, Shure, Monster DNA are higher rated and you definitely get what you pay for. If you are really picky about audio and good base don't buy these. Save your cash and upgrade. I have Bose, Sennheiser sport and Monster DNA which are all much better in regards to sound quality/bass and product construction.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus Decimus Meridius

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are almost perfect, only thing missing is volume control on the line. Other than that these are great for music and calls, also do a fair to good job of blocking noise from outside. Additionally, I have accidentally run these through the wash, in a pocket of my pants, twice now and they still work great... I would not recommend this, but it is nice to know they are still ok after being washed and dried twice.
customer_reviews.author: Royib812

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought these as a replacement for my Turtle Beach wireless headset because the weight of them were causing headaches. No echo and sound is crisp! The only things that bug me is the weight of them since they do have some girth to them (but for the sound quality, it is to be expected) and and no volume controls on the cable itself so the volume needs to be controlled by whatever it is plugged into. Still, they are a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kirsch

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these per recommendation from my boyfriend. These fit well, the wire is well made, and also does not tangle easily due to the flat wire design. I hope these will last a long time! So far, I have been using these very consistently for about 3 months now. I do appreciate the little pouch they also provide, but they definitely could have put a little more effort into it. (Flimsy cloth draw string pouch)
customer_reviews.author: Oh Family

customer_reviews.title: Something is different
customer_reviews.text: So I have purchased these headphones 3 or 4 different times (both here and at a big chain electronics store) - sometimes I lose them, sometimes my kids do. I've purchased them in red and blue, not that it should matter. The sound quality, in my opinion, is great for the price. However, the last set I received, something is different. They feel very cheap and plastic. Not sure if I will order them again... Does not feel nice at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always love Sony headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of earbuds that were over $100 and I still prefer these. Only reason I had to replace my last pair was my BF accidentally washed them in the water and dryer. The sound is excellent, the noise cancelling is so good it helps drown out when the BF is bugging,. They always fit better than other earbuds, i don't have to keep pushing them back in as they slowly fall out. These always stay in place. I always highly recommend Sony earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, somewhat durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones 3 times. I keep buying them because they sound great, they're comfortable and they fit well enough to block out a lot of the background noise. I've had to replace them every year, but I do beat them up a lot. I commute every day on the bus and I've taken them on the plane around the world. I just coil them up and shove them in my pocket or bag when I'm in a rush. They stand up to that beating for about a year, then I have to buy a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Flamingo

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones look, sound, and feel good. They don’t tangle easily, as so many earbuds do, and the best feature is how well the rubber ear guards stay on the phones-so many fall off way too easily. I will say that I’m not sure about the extra bass aspect, although that’s always a plus to me. I don’t usually listen to music with these, I listen to Audible books, so I can’t address that issue knowledgeably. The set comes with a carrying case and extra rubber tips in a few sizes because, although it’s harder to lose these tips,it can happen, so don’t take that feature for granted!
customer_reviews.author: PapihuahaMom

customer_reviews.title: Skip it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this headset cause I wanted some earbud with a mic. The earbud aren't very comfortable and hurts my ears and the microphone is pathetic to say the least. I have to hold it to my mouth and speak loudly for it to come out loud enough for the receiver. I think some of the earbud that came with my phones worked better than this. My recommendation is to skip this pair maybe pay a bit more for one that's better.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Pand

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced wired earbuds
customer_reviews.text: The Sony brand is what brought me to consider the Sony Extra Bass Earbuds for my daughter after she lost another pair. I didn't want to plunk down big money on the latest and greatest, but these looked like a possibility for the sweet spot between cheap and break-the-bank. After 6 months of daily use, the Sony's are holding up well and performing as expected. Much better than some others in terms of sound quality and durability at this price point. If you are looking for wired, in-ear headphones, these are worth considering.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Polk

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 3 months, but poor construction quality - one earbud separated (no damage, just detached where it is “glued” together) and is no longer usable. Sony does not stand by product and considers it “damage” even though there is no product damage (mint condition other than the 2 loosened pieces) so I would stay away from these. Note - bought the protection plan but that doesn’t cover anything since they’re still under Sony’s guarantee - don’t waste your money on those plans either.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapmom

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP, GOOD BASS, BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Not an audiophile or anything but I can hear the bass on these earphones. Noise cancelling is fantastic, can’t hear people talking to me. I noticed a bit of white noise, but think it has to do with my laptop, no white sound on my desktop. Using these for gaming and music, hate wearing headphones. They mess up my hair and getting a bit numbing from wearing headphones all day. Get a separate mic and boom arm if you need a mic. Haven’t tested the mic but probably a bad mic.
customer_reviews.author: Hyoung Jin Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting from Sony
customer_reviews.text: I bought these earbuds and didn't use them until after Christmas. The first time I used them they were fine — left and right ear buds both worked. Sound was fair, but for the price I consider them adequate. However the second time I used them the right ear did not work No sound from that at all. I've checked them on another device and still no sound in the right ear. So, No, I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Leah M.  Camara

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck hands down
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried every type of headphone. For me this type (where a rubber ear bud creates a seal with your ear canal) always works best. Not only do they stay in place well but the bass and sound is always the best. A huge driver found in over the ear headphones isn’t needed if there’s a seal between the driver and your ear. This is the smartest way to way headphones. Sound is better than $300+ over the ear designs.
customer_reviews.author: Dingus Kahn

customer_reviews.title: These earbuds are great especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are great especially for the price! They don't fall out of my ears at the gym and the sound quality is surprisingly good. When I use them to talk on the phone - usually at work, outside, I get complaints that the noise from passing trains and other downtown noises come through painfully loud so I generally don't use them to talk on the phone. On my end everything sounds great, it's the receivers who complain. They come with a cloth pouch and a packet of different size bud covers.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Teeta

customer_reviews.title: extremely uncomfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: sound and quality wise these seem fine, but they are without a doubt the most uncomfortable headphones i have ever experienced. no matter what bud size i wear, there’s a bulky part of hard plastic that presses into my ear. the only way i can wear them without pain is to have them so loose in the ear that they fall out very easily. i’m definitely not gonna be able to continue using these. since i don’t see many other complaints about this, i’m guessing its more of a problem for smaller ears, so if that’s you i’d recommend looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Get these instead of that throwaway pair you're considering
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect pair of headphones if you are looking for a quality pair of headphones but not willing to jump in that +$50 range. The bass does come through well. The earbuds are narrow and snugly fit in my ear. I can go running with these without getting that hollow sound that some headphones generate in the wind. The little button on the headphones to pause or skip tracks is a cute add-on but I could do without it. Only con is that they do stick out a bit from the ear, so you wouldn't be able to lie down or lean your head against something comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Nick DiDomizio

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones I've ever bought, Period
customer_reviews.text: Just got these bad boys in the mail and I can't take them out of my ears! Honestly the best headphones I have ever bought in my life. They stay in my ear really well so I feel like they wont be a problem on the treadmill in the gym. I also listen to a lot of EDM (Electric Dance Music) and the bass in this genre of music is very high. With that said, the bass on these headphones is insane and I would suggest these headphones very highly to anyone looking for an all around great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Best ever..
customer_reviews.text: By far the best head phones i ever owned.. price is good the sound it great.. it cancels out noise around me. The bass is beyond what i expected... i love these sooo much that i plan on buying a back up for mine because im so scared of going a day with out them... yea they are that worth it. Would recommend them to everyone...
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great bass, great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Nintendo Switch. I play mostly on my train commute to work. I didn't want headphones that go over my head because it flattens down my hair. And I wanted something that packs away small. But I still wanted good sound. I previously purchased a set of Panasonic ear buds and used those for quite a while but knew it wasn't cutting it. These are great. They block out a lot of sound, and just as it's advertised, yes it has a lot more bass. The depth of sound is so much better than what I had. This is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Josh D

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but disappointed but might keep
customer_reviews.text: Update: After looking for other earbuds, I got the idea to flip them so the cord actually goes over the ear. Gonna give it a try before I just return them Because they are so comfortable. Original: They are really comfortable in the ears because of how they are designed. However, the earphones aren’t interchangeable left and right. I like the mic on the right ear, but it falls out if I wear the left one in the right ear. Unfortunately, I will be returning. I so wanted these to work.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Great bass, but terrible noise
customer_reviews.text: Yes, these have very good sound quality. The sound quality is amazing, actually. The only problem, which for me is a big one, is that every time your cable even threatens to move, you heave that through the earbuds. It's hard to explain, but if you compare this with your apple earbuds, you will certainly tell the difference. In my case, it is so annoying I simply can't use it for longer periods.
customer_reviews.author: Natan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound. Other areas need improvement.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is excellent, which is the reason I purchased these for a second time. However, there are a couple of areas of annoyance, which is the reason for the 4 stars. I am extremely annoyed that there is no shirt clip as there was last time. Also, the switch should also contain a volume control. The earbuds that came with my Note 8 have sturdy braided cable, which all earbuds should have. They also have a volume control. However, the sound is not nearly as good as Sony produces.
customer_reviews.author: DAM1

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Tiny Ear Canals!
customer_reviews.text: My headphones at work kept falling out on every call. These are so much better. I chose the second-to-smallest fitting and it fits very nicely. Goes right into the ear canal and stays put, even when chewing, talking. The noise cancellation is really good, almost too good at work - people can sneak up behind me! Much better than the Skully Candy I used to use that didn't fit in my ears at all.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wing

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bass. Nice Sound.
customer_reviews.text: I know what your thinking because I thought the same thing. I am buying a $10 set of earbuds for $30. Nope, these have an excellent sound quality. I bought these as a back-up to my $200 wireless buds. Now I wear/prefer the sound quality of these when I don't need the wireless freedom. Very impressed with Bass and range.
customer_reviews.author: Irma H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I am totally excited about the great sound quality. I listen mostly to classical music, and this is by far the best (cheaper) set of earphones I’ve had so far. The clarity and depth of a wide range of sounds, from the deep sounds of cellos and bass to the higher ones of violins or oboes, it’s all very exciting. They also fit in my arms very well and are comfortable. Happy customer.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound; everyday ear buds
customer_reviews.text: These are replacements for the last pair of the same headphones i had and misplaced. Great sound. No complaints at all with that. Not noise cancelling but they block out external sounds to meet my needs, even on a motorcycle. With a helmet, though, they do have more of a presence in/on the ear and can be uncomfortable when removing your helmet. One nit is the BRIGHT red color. Would have preferred Sony to have the ear piece in red and the cord black.
customer_reviews.author: Willeyez

customer_reviews.title: Great for calls
customer_reviews.text: I think this is my favorite 'stuck-at-home-because-of-pandemic' purchase. My husband and I often need to be in the same room, but working on different items. So I needed good ear buds with good quality sound, comfortable, and a good microphone for taking phone calls and teleconferences. This has made our life much more comfortable. I ask those I'm on calls with if the hear me well - with this headset they say they hear me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Muddy.
customer_reviews.text: Extra bass is all these are. Okay for 30 bucks but even as a bass fan they're hard to recomend as that extra bass comes at the cost of just being muddy everywhere. I'll keep them as a back up pair I guess but was hoping for a bit more from Sony. I remember a set of sony buds I had years back that was great for a similar price. Guess it's just what we get in the race to the bottom. All hail the roi.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sound.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few wired earbuds. These are the "best". GREAT value, GREAT SOUND and WELL BUILT. I use them all the time. Had a flippin EXPENSIVE set of wired Bose that I gave a way about 5 years ago...these are way better, and 1/3rd the cost. I don't like being a "Sony Fanboy" but daggon it...they keep outperforming everybody. I think that if you are going to beat these, you are going to have to go full-on wired studio ear-muff type headphones.
customer_reviews.author: J just J

customer_reviews.title: Yep! THESE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I went from a $5.98 pair of P.O.S. earbuds to these. I am in heaven!!! I have had bad, good and great buds over time...these are fantastic! They fit wonderful right out of the box and the sound amazing! Not banging bass but that's not what I wanted. That being said the bass is outstanding! Good sound without rattling your eardrums. Pick these and i think you'll be surprised how good they actually are!
customer_reviews.author: Chevygirl169

customer_reviews.title: Ok....
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are ok, but just ok. As the volume increases, the sound quality decreases. I think this happens with most earbuds on planet Earth. I'm done spending a lot of money on earbuds, so I chose these. Not a bad choice. They are light, comfortable, and with the soft ear tips you can really cram them in your ear. If you are a whore for sound quality like I am, just don't turn them up too loud.
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: i am so in love with these
customer_reviews.text: i am so in love with these. when i can i am going to buy the more expensive version but these play sound better then any headphones I've owned including my Bose pair i have owned these for a year now and unfortunately they recently got lost in a move. even so, after a year of daily usage they worked perfectly and i was so sad when i couldn't find them ; ; i will be ordering a new pair asap and will probably never buy any other kind unless there's a better version of these.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Bass hits harder than grandpa
customer_reviews.text: Great bass, amazing for rap and hip hop, but there is is not any form of active noise cancelling, it does have different size ear tips for the best seal fit, which seals great for me, and comes in a nice carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Trace Hagemeier

customer_reviews.title: These are great! Noise Cancellation is the best I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried so many different ear buds. These are FAR superior to any of them. I am more than happy with this purchase and that's rare! I wish the cord was a bit longer, but what are ya gonna do. Sound quality is excellent! I haven't been able to figure out how to make it sound good with my UM2 Behringer Mixer yet, but that's because I'm a newb at it. I got these for $30 on sale from $50.
customer_reviews.author: Justice

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but not as great of sound as I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on others reviews. They're okay but not as great as I expected. I feel there's a scratchy sound when I use them regardless of what device they're plugged into. Kind of like a background noise when there's no singing or talking. But they are very comfortable. The earbuds remind me of my old Littmann stethoscope and how the ear pieces settled in the ear facing forward if that makes sense. From that perspective I find them extremely comfortable there's no pain and I do feel like it cancels some outside noise.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Radinsky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound at an attractive price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an older version of this same model. These in the ear headphones feature very solid bass with no boominess, good mid range and very good high frequency response. I had them on my watch list and when they went on sale, I grabbed them. They are very durable and well built. They are comfortable to wear even for long sessions. I would recommend these over other headphones of this type that cost three or four times as much.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Sledge

customer_reviews.title: Worst Sony Product and Earbuds I have ever tried!
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to try these based on all the positive reviews but they must have been fake or this product must be fake. The music I played through these was completely garbled and unintelligible. I have never had a bad Sony product so I can only think these are counterfeit Chinese junk. Any music played through these just sounds like jumbled noise. Amazing how anyone could give an honest review above 1 star!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Does not sit well with m ears
customer_reviews.text: Its an overall good quality earbuds but to be honest they keep falling out my ears even when i changed them to smallest size. I have pretty small ears and honestly it was my fault for purchasing them knowing that these in ear buds never do well for me but its a nice quality. its not completely noise canceling like i can tell still hear when someone calls out my name lol
customer_reviews.author: Damion

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted buds instead of earphones and these fit the bill. I like the red color too. My use will be to listen to my music on the internet on my computer while the wife watches her shows on the tv. so far all is good. The one thing missing at this price point is a volume control adjustment. But since win-amp can be adjusted within the program its not a big deal. The pouch bag to store the buda and the extra rubber ear pieces is nice plus.
customer_reviews.author: STANLEY STARR

customer_reviews.title: The bass is exceptional!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping all the good reviews that I read were true. I received this product and the sound quality is absolutely, great! I intentionally put on a song with a lot of bass to see if the bass experience was good...and it was phenomenal! Fast shipping and all that I expected!
customer_reviews.author: thomonica ware

customer_reviews.title: Extra bass, and that's all you'll hear.
customer_reviews.text: The bass is pretty overwhelming for casual music listening on these. And it's not even a crisp, clear bass a lot of time. Rest of the sound quality is pretty mediocre. With that said, I think these earbuds are constructed really well, the cord is a good length and rarely gets tangled even in the slightest. Fits comfortably in my ears, though the shape and weight can cause them to slip out if you're more active. Made this purchase on impulse because I liked how the earbuds look, but I think there are much better options both cheaper and more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for everyone to enjoy
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are perfect for lawn work. Keep in mind, the best quality from these headphones will come if you can fit them at an angle that produces a "vacuum" feeling in your ears. I could barely hear my weed whacker outside! And the sound from the headphones is rich, while the headphones themselves don't feel cheap. The cable feels very sturdy as well, which compliments the 90° jack.
customer_reviews.author: Liam O'Brien

product_meta.title: Sony MDRXB50AP Extra Bass Earbud Headphones/Headset with Mic for Phone Call, Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingSony MDRXB50AP Extra Bass Earbud Headset (Black) Cord Length: 3.94 ft; Frequency Response: 4-24,000Hz, 4–24,000Hz; Cord Type: Y type, flat cord.Frequency Response :4–24,000Hz.
feature_bullets: 12 millimeter dome type driver units deliver powerful deep bass. Connectivity Technology: Wired
Integrated microphone and smartphone playback control
Hybrid silicone earbuds for secure, comfortable fit
High energy neodymium magnets for powerful sound
Tangle free, Y type flat cord with slider. Capacity 100 mW. Diaphragm:PET
Lightweight for ultimate music mobility. 0.47 in neodymium drivers for powerful, balanced sound

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars9,773 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
